content.title: Annai Teresa Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Orphan Girls-II
content.department: Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department
content.details: The 'Annai Teresa Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Orphan Girls-I' was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme provides financial assistance to the orphan girls for their marriage. The bride should have completed 18 years of age at the time of marriage.
benefits: One sovereign (8gm) 22-carat gold coin for making Thirumangalyam
eligibility: The applicant should be a girl
The applicant should be an orphan
The bride should be 18 years or above at the time of marriage
The applicant should have a degree passed from regular colleges, distance education/government-recognized open university
The applicant should have a diploma passed from the Institution recognized by the Directorate of Technical Education, Government of Tamil Nadu
content.application_process: Online - via CSCs. Offline: The applicant should gather copies of the necessary documents needed to apply for the concerned scheme, visit the nearest Common Service Center (CSC) and complete the Biometric Verification Process, fill in all the mandatory fields in the application form and upload copies of all the mandatory documents, and request a receipt or acknowledgment from the CSC.
documents_required: Death Certificate of Father & Mother or Orphan Certificate (Issued by a Member of Parliament (MP)/ Member of the Legislative Assembly (MLA))
Bills towards the Purchase of Marriage Articles for ₹1,000/-
Any other document as required by the Department

faqs.question: What is the objective of the Annai Teresa Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Orphan Girls?
faqs.answer: The objective is to provide financial assistance to orphan girls for their marriage.

faqs.question: What assistance is provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: ₹50,000 is provided through Electronic Clearing Service along with 1 Sovereign (8gm) 22-carat gold coin for making Thirumangalyam.

faqs.question: Is there an income limit for eligibility?
faqs.answer: No, there is no income limit for eligibility.

faqs.question: What is the time limit for submitting an application before the marriage date?
faqs.answer: The application should be submitted 40 days before the marriage date. In exceptional circumstances, it can be submitted one day prior to the marriage date.

faqs.question: Who should be contacted for assistance regarding this scheme?
faqs.answer: District Social Welfare Officers and Extension Officers (Social Welfare) should be contacted for assistance.

faqs.question: What is the probable time limit for processing applications?
faqs.answer: Applications are processed within 15 days from the date of receipt.

faqs.question: Will applications submitted after the marriage date be accepted?
faqs.answer: No, applications received on or after the date of marriage will not be entertained.

faqs.question: Where should grievances be reported at the district level?
faqs.answer: Grievances should be reported to the District Collector/District Social Welfare Officer.

faqs.question: Where should grievances be reported at the state level?
faqs.answer: Grievances should be reported to the Director of Social Welfare, 2nd Floor, Panagal Maaligai, Saidapet, Chennai – 600 015, with phone number 044-24351885.

faqs.question: Is there any provision for extending the time limit for submitting applications in exceptional circumstances?
faqs.answer: Yes, in exceptional circumstances, applications can be submitted one day prior to the marriage date.

faqs.question: Are there any penalties for late submission of applications?
faqs.answer: Penalties for late submission of applications are not specified in the scheme guidelines.
